item.title: Report X-2024081687
item.description:
Report X-2024081687

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-28T15:13:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-15
  • City: LIVONIA
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER CALLED TO A LEAKING PACKAGE IN THE INPUT. WEARING FULL PPE, AND WITH DECISION TREE RESPONDED TO THE LEAKING PACKAGE. USING DECISION TREE, RESPONDER WAS LED TO THE CORROSIVE SOLIDS OR LIQUIDS HAZARD CLASS RESPONSE SHEET. TORE OFF 5 INCHES OF PH TAPE AND COULD NOT DEICPHER IF THE TAPE WAS BLUE BECAUSE THAT WAS ALSO THE COLOR OF THE SPILLED LIQUID. RESPONDER STILL USED SODIUM BICARBINATE UNTIL IT RESULTED IN NEUTRAL PH TAPE. THEN CLEANED THE SPILL AND TRANSFERED IT TO THE DMP WHERE RESPONDER COMPLETED THE REST OF THE CLEANUP DMP PROCESS.

item.title: Report X-2024081519
item.description:
Report X-2024081519

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-27T06:25:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-09
  • City: ROMULUS
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ON Aug 8h a package was discovered during the offload process that was leaking. The bucket contained 3077, ENVIRONMENTALLY HAZARDOUS SOLID, N.O.S., 9, III. We are unsure how the damage occured that cause the leak. The package was placed in a steel salvage drum and the shipper was contacted to pick up the pacakge.

item.title: Report E-2024080566
item.description:
Report E-2024080566

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-26T06:17:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-19
  • City: PETOSKEY
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ESTES personnel observed approximately twenty (20) gallons of material released from one (1) 330-gallon poly tote. The released material impacted the trailer floor. ESTES personnel cleaned the impacted area and containerized all cleanup debris. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.
